DataElement.preferredName: Current Systemic Chemotherapy Or Radiation Therapy Cancer Treatment For Prior Or Synchronous Administered Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable response to a question related to concurrent use of other anti-cancer therapy including chemotherapy agents, target agents, or biological agents.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Current Systemic Chemotherapy Or Radiation Therapy Cancer Treatment For Prior Or Synchronous Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time._(sis-TEM-ik) Affecting the entire body._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04)_An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Any intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm._The reason of something._Earlier in time or order._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An adjustment that causes something to occur or recur in unison._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Any intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any other investigational drugs within 28 days (or five half-lives, whichever is shorter; with a minimum of 14 days from the last dose) preceding the first dose of study drugs and during the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received anticanc
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received anticancer therapy including chemotherapy, radiotherapy, hormonal (with the exception of hormones for thyroid conditions), and other investigational agents within 14 days or five (5) half-lives (whichever is longer) prior to the first dose of romidepsin (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any other investigational agents or has received any other investigational drugs within 28 days (or five half-lives, whichever is shorter; with a minimum of 14 days from the last dose) preceding the first dose of study treatment and during the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any systemic chemotherapy within 3 weeks or radiotherapy (except for palliative reasons) within 4 weeks prior to study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any systemic chemotherapy or radiotherapy (except for palliative reasons) within 3 weeks prior to study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any systemic chemotherapy or radiotherapy (except for palliative reasons) within 3 weeks prior to study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or overlapping radiotherapy for lung cancer?
